author: frozenfire.eth
content: <@563394111214714881> Before I embark on figuring it out myself, have you given any consideration to how to make Patronum's proofs efficiently portable?

author: frozenfire.eth
content: I'm thinking of creating a protobuf serialization of the needed data, efficiently compressed where possible.

author: frozenfire.eth
content: It might also be interesting to reproducibly compile the EVM simulation of the RPC call into a portable WASM

author: frozenfire.eth
content: That way, RPC gateways - or other gateways that need to show their work - can take on the heavy lifting, and the client can just run their semi-trusted verifier

author: philngo
content:
Hey Justin! I made a proposal at the light clients workshop at Devcon regarding this, hoping to consolidate some feedback from people working in the light client dev ecosystem about how to go about this. Unfortunately, the audio did not get recorded, but here are the slides from the presentation:
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1fKfsGYEYoLWoZGFjtKeLjSU8wa8GRx1brf9CvMu1LWU/edit?usp=sharing

TL;DR: I'm looking to see how we can better persist, discuss and collaborate all our efforts in this part of the ecosystem and to create a better DevEx for those looking to contribute to this effort. I'm going to start with creating a wiki of information (likely using Notion) about this ecosystem, what people are working on and references to everyone's contributed efforts.

Currently, we have a github repo (https://github.io/ethereum-light-clients), Twitter (https://twitter.com/ethlightclients), Telegram Announcements (https://t.me/+vKomz6woYTBkNGIx), Discord (this channel) and central domain (https://lightclients.xyz) - which will likely become the new wiki page.
